page.title: 14EDUCATION SCHOOL TRANSPORT
page.content: The means of transport are bus, cars, bicycles and walking. The majority of the younger children use the bus whereas the older children use more varied methods. Bicycling is only allowed for children in class 3 and the school runs with R.O.S.P.A. the National Cycling Proficiency Test. The bus leaves Alderbury at 8.30..p.m. and arrives at 8.40.a.m. In the afternoon it leaves school soon after 3.00.p.m. On Tuesdays the children go swimming and are drooped off at Alderbury on the way back. On Wednesdays it leaves school at 3.45. so there are clubs. 38 children use the bus, 7 children are brought in the carsand another 7 children use them when it is raining.13 children walk to school and 5 regularly ride their bicycles.
